resources.string: Choose an Option Below to Start

The following test is called the Ishihara Test. Its purpose is to detect a red-green color deficiency in the test taker. You will be presented 10 images in which you will have to correctly identify the number on the screen. If you cannot identify the number, select the \"Not Sure\" button to skip the image. Please do not enter a random number as this may skew the results. When the test is complete, you will be redirected to a page where the results will be presented.
DISCLAIMER: THIS TEST SHOULD ONLY BE USED TO ALERT THE TEST TAKER OF A POSSIBLE COLOR VISION DEFICIENCY AND SHOULD NOT BE USED AS A MEANS TO MEDICALLY IDENTIFY A COLOR VISION DEFICIENCY.
Based on your answers, you do not have a red-green color vision deficiency.

Based on your answers, you may have some form of a red-green color vision deficiency. \n\n You can find the images you were not able to identify below. Adjust the slider until you can identify each number.
